data.title: mines/tiberium trees emit resources from their highest point instead of base
data.body: Tiberium trees are 2 tiles high, and tiberium comes out of the top tile, which is unintuitive and not the most effective use of space when designing a map. Would be better if resources would center around the base of the tree, as it should.

data.title: renders: image: x does not inherit icon name anymore
data.body:
(I'm pretty sure this is what's happening, as of ~0413 or so.)

When I have unit NewBuilding and its yaml is like this:

```
NewBuilding:
    RenderBuilding:
       Image: BLDG
```

If you don't specify an icon for NewBuilding, it will crash. In the past, it would load bldgicon.shp by default if no other icon is specified. Now you have to specify one, and the game crashes if newbuildingicon.shp doesn't exist. I think if you're referencing a different image, it should assume that you want all the values inherited from that image (icons, sequences, etc.) unless you specify otherwise.

data.title: Add `Required` slot checking in lobby logic. Set up needed player slots as Required for missions
Added Unit Order Palette
data.body:
Thanks to
- @chrisforbes 
- @pchote
- @JamesDunne
- @xanax

I just rebased and did the last commit.

data.title: d2k-tanks get increased spread, 4 -> 6
data.body: Tanks get chewed up pretty good by bazookas, and dont do much damage to infantry. This will help a bit to hurt infantry that are clumped up in the same cell.

data.title: A Drop Zone map for C&C
data.body: Made a Drop Zone for the C&C mod.

data.title: Don't start next to opponent in team games.
data.body:
When you're in a team game (2vs2), the game puts you and your teammate in the wrong positions by default.
If you're in an east vs. west game, where the map is very clear what side you're supposed to be on, the program will put two opponents right next to each other, and allies away from each other by default. In order to not have this, you have to pick your starting location every time. 
The algorithm for starting location is to pick one player's starting location, and then pick the next player's starting location as far away as possible. Unfortunately this means in a 2vs2 team game that you end up as far away as possible from your teammate.
It would be nice if the program would automatically guess which sides of the map were supposed to be which, and assume that the starting locations of the teammates are supposed to be close together and that one should not start close to an opponent's starting location, by default.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/244909-don-t-start-next-to-opponent-in-team-games?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Separate UPnP from Game/Server into it's own class
data.body: It was a little scattered around. This should clean it up again.

data.title: Don't try discover routers by default and expose setting to GUI
data.body: @clemx and @TiriliPiitPiit reported problems with https://github.com/mono/Mono.Nat which I did not expect nor can resolve properly so I hearby give up. To workaround the feature is disabled by default, but the switch to enable it is exposed to the GUI now so people can hopefully find it easily.

data.title: Fixes Documentation.html indentions
data.body: The http://packages.ubuntu.com/markdown from the OpenRA build server does not understand http://github.github.com/github-flavored-markdown/ so OpenRA.Utility has to use extra tabs to define the code area properly

data.title: Added resource splattering for destroyed units and weapons
data.body:
You now have 2 methods to achieve #2346:
- Attach it to a husk spawned from a unit (`SeedsResources` is not limited to buildings anymore)
- Attach it to a building which has a `DeadBuildingState` with some lingering time and use the new `SplatterUponDestruction` boolean in `SeedsResources`.

data.title: Enemy unit behaviour regression in some scripted missions

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: I suspect shroud to be the reason that enemy units don't want to begin attacking until you first meet them. Probably introduced with recent per-player shroud changes

data.title: Added RALint check for missing sequence definitions and fixed them in d2k mod
data.body: I fixed some breakage introduced by #3070 and added a new RALint check as proposed in #2283 to help me track all missing sprite sequences down.

data.title: Allow "MaxCharges: 0" for AttackTesla
data.body:
I would like the Obelisk of Light in C&C to use AttackTesla, so that it can charge up properly and give the nice charging sound. However, it does not work because it requirse that the Obelisk be charged up and ready to fire at all times. The Obelisk is not supposed to fire immediately, it must wait to charge up. Unfortunately with AttackTesla, it only supports firing a shot that is already charged up:

```
AttackTesla:
    MaxCharges: 0
```

This simply disables AttackTesla. The behavior it should have instead is to have no charges saved up, but to allow it to charge and then discharge once. The Nod Obelisk is supposed to charge up before every shot. This coincides with the animation and sound.

data.title: Have helis take off after repaired / re-armed
data.body: Helicopters that repair sit on the helipad or repair bay should take off and go to the rally point after they're done repairing (& rearming?). Currently they just sit there after repairing. They should take off and make room for the next heli wanting to repair. This also crucially allows units being built to exit the helipad so that production isn't held up.

data.title: allow seeing enemy guard tower ranges
data.body:
It would be nice if I could select/mouseover enemy guard towers (even in fog) and have their range/detection radius show up. Useful if you're trying to sneak around them, instead of guesstimate. Newbs won't have as good idea what the ranges are.

data.title: Harvesters can get stuck on unloading
data.body:
They seem to get stuck at the refinery when multiple harvesters are about to unload at the same refinery. The harvester that should unload does not unload and only unloads after you explicitly order it to. It happens pretty often during games where you have multiple harvesters attached to one refinery.

data.body: I think it would make sense that harvesters that belong to a player who lost, could be given to the other players of the team.

data.title: APC gun was overpowered vs. heavy. Back at 30%
Dune2000 Terraforming
data.body:
In Dune2000, it would be really nice to have a new unit (what about the thumper ?) to terraform the environment.

I know maps are based of tiles and it might not be easy to modify them while the game is started but spice fields already change their tiles after the harvester comes.

When maps are not well designed, sometimes players lack of free space to settle their bases. It would be interesting to be able to create "islands", rising up from the sand, with the help of this "thumper" unit.

This way, we could expand bases on new areas.

data.title: allow force-move with Alt-key
data.body: I want to crush infantry but when I place the cursor over the target infantry, the cursor changes to "attack". When I press the Alt key, it does not go to "force move" the way that holding Ctrl goes to "force fire". I would like to be able to tell my units to force-move on to a tile. This would also be useful if you simply want to maneuver your tank to that location but it's impossible to give move orders because there are too many enemy units changing your cursor to "attack".
